description.p: Joe is an absolutely obsessive malt drinker, he simply cannot get enough. Most annoyingly though, he almost never has any money, so his only obvious legal way to obtain more malt is to take the money he gets when he recycles empty malt bottles to buy new ones. In addition to the empty bottles resulting from his own consumption he sometimes finds empty bottles in the street. One day he was extra thirsty, so he actually drank malts until he couldn't afford a new one.

Three non-negative integers e; f; c, where e < 1000 equals the number of empty malt bottles in Joe's possession at the start of the day, f < 1000 the number of empty malt bottles found during the day, and 1 < c < 2000 the number of empty bottles required to buy a new malt.
How many malts did Joe drink on his extra thirsty day?
